This is silly, and loses all of the attacking pressure. 21. g4 would be much more sensible, and the threat of g5 is big:

21. g4 e5 22. fxe5 dxe5 23.Qxe5 wins a pawn and the threat of Bxf7 is big (discovered attack on the queen with the rook, and if the queen goes down the f6 knight is unprotected).

If 37... Kxb4 then 38.Kb6 wins as black cannot prevent white from getting to the black pawns. If black goes towards g3, c2 can Queen when the white king reaches d6.
